European Aviation Network

World-leading innovation in aviation connectivity

The first hybrid LTE / satellite connectivity network of it's kind worldwide. Combining an advanced S-band satellite service with a complimentary ground-to-air network to provide high capacity coverage across the whole of Europe.

Advanced onboard equipment. Built through a partnership of leading innovators in mobile connectivity and aviation.

Superior passenger experience

Meeting passenger demand for true inflight broadband - consistent in-the-air as on-the-ground quality of service. Giving passengers the freedom to enjoy besides messaging and social media high bandwidth applications like email, web browsing, video streaming, and VPN access while they fly.

Designed for Europe

Coverage across all 28 EU member states. Engineered for high density airspace. Enhanced capacity for the busiest European routes & hubs. Developed by European companies

Scalable solution to meet growing demand

With a uniquely scalable architecture to match growing demand allowing network capacity to be increased quickly and cost effectively in response to traffic growth, more aircraft installation, route system change and/or evolving passenger behaviour.

Low total cost of operation

Driving competitive advantage and passenger loyalty with new standards of service. Unlocking new direct and indirect ancillary revenue streams, like e-commerce, advertising, sponsorship and paid IFE. Low Capex, installation, Opex and maintenance.

Lightweight, low drag but high reliable equipment. All at TCO up to 3.5x lower than the satellite only solutions. Demand-driven and future proof solution- fast extension without incurring significant costs.

Meeting the demands of passengers,
now and in the future

Worldwide travellers now expect to stay connected via their smart devices and laptops when they are in the sky. Inflight connectivity has become a key differentiator in airline choice.

of European passengers are eager to have high-speed Internet on flights

The survey results underline the fact that airlines need to offer a reliable, high-quality broadband service to boost passenger levels and avoid losing out to their competitors.

Inmarsat and Deutsche Telekom have the networks, services and infrastructure to deliver the capacity that surging demand for fast, reliable and global connectivity requires, now and in the future.

The European Aviation Network will meet the connectivity needs of airlines flying across Europe.

choose an airline based on broadband availability

expect onboard connectivity to replace in-flight entertainment in 5-10 years

would choose staying online over in-flight meals

bring 3 devices on Board

are willing to pay on any flight length in Europe

say a relieable connection is more important than speed

* 2015 In-Flight Connectivity Survey conducted by Inmarsat (LSE: ISAT.L), the leading provider of global mobile satellite communications services, and market research company GfK.
